title: [Large-scale] Machine Learning Modeling for Catalyst Material Development in Solid Oxide Fuel Cells/Electrolyzers

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic chemistry and physics knowledge, catalytic reaction concepts, and fundamental principles of machine learning
context.additional_context: Enhancing practical problem-solving skills through virtual material synthesis and performance evaluation simulations in VR environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain procedures for building machine learning models to predict oxygen reduction/evolution reaction catalyst performance

Learners can interpret machine learning model predictions (e.g., XGBoost, LightGBM) using SHAP (Shapley Additive Explanations) and create a report visualizing the impact analysis of five material properties (e.g., strength, durability) via bar plots and summary plots.
Screening of high-performance catalyst candidates is possible from a perovskite material database of over 19 million entries
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
